fields.summary: Increase the max number of users to retrieve for assignee to a higher number
title search in Attach Google Docs window is un-clickable, not all doc types attach
JIRA service does not start on Win7 (x64) if Java is not installed (Tomcat 7)
As a user, I'd like to share dashboards with a specific user, not group or project role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29428].
  {panel}

It's not unusual for me to do the following in JIRA:
# Comment on an issue.
# Close that same issue.
# Create a new issue.
# Attach several screen shots to the new issue.
# Edit the new issue to fix a typo
# Link it back to the just closed issue.

If I do all this I basically take over the activity stream for everyone else. What if instead of six discrete entries in the activity stream it queued them up for a few minutes and then only showed the last one? Something like:

_John Doe linked an issue (and five other changes)_

The "five other changes" would be a link that, when clicked, expanded the other changes and showed the activity stream in its full glory. This is somewhat analogous to what FishEye does for changesets.
fields.summary: Group Together Changes in Activity Stream so Busy User Doesn't Pollute It
Make Issue Excel View able to use an unsaved "Filter Columns order"
UI puts emphasis on Workflow actions over current status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29425].
  {panel}

When user want to share an issue, the share window is too small on IE browser. See this:
!IE.PNG|thumbnail!
Unlike the Firefox or Google Chrome which can allow user to drag the text box by click and drage on the button at down-right coner.
Firefox text box like:
!firefox.PNG|thumbnail!

Besides, in Firefox or Ghrome, when user drag the text box overload the window, the text will goes beyond. It will be looks like:
!text beyond.PNG|thumbnail!

Those actions are very inconvenience when user perform the share funtion.
fields.summary: Share issue Window is too small on IE
Issue collector jumps to 'Name' field in Chrome
"No group membership" warning on new Google user is misleading
Project selection dropdown should show project key as well as name
Option to restart flushing mails without restart JIRA
Ability to search for content by user @mention
Add REST method to retrieve list of labels.
Frame Size Should Make use of the Screen size

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29407].
  {panel}

Please see attached screenshot.

When looking at an issue, the following columns are shown for sub-tasks:
Number | Summary | Issue Type Icon | Status Icon | Status Text | Assignee

but for linked issues the following columns are shown:
Link Type | Issue Type Icon | Issue Key | Summary | Priority Icon | Status Icon

Especially the missing 'Status Text' for linked issues is giving us a lot of trouble, because it is difficult to assess the status of e.g. blocking issues. We believe this should be homogenized because sub-tasks are also just (internally) linked issues.

If there is a way of customizing the behavior through the configuration, please point me to it. I still believe it is a valid improvement request and the current behavior needs to be changed.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Show the same information for linked issues and subtasks (e.g. status text, issue key)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29406].
  {panel}

Since we are heavily relying on linking between issues I would like to raise a feature request for the following two use cases:

(1) We would like to define contexts or schemes that allow us to restrict link types to certain subsets of projects, because right now we have set up a lot of link types that do not make sense for all of the projects we have.

(2) Internal link types / hiding of link types from users even though they are valid for the current project. This would be very useful for us because we are automatically linking tickets using special "internal" link types that were raised from other projects (e.g. L1 / L2 / QA / etc.). If a user can edit / create these manually, it can break our whole link structure. Basically we want to do the same JIRA does with it's internal subtask link that users cannot manually edit.

(3) Advanced permissions on who can use a certain link type. This is particularly useful when removing link types that e.g. identify blockers for a certain issue.
fields.summary: Link Type Context / Internal Link Type / Advanced Linking Permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29405].
  {panel}

Copied to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-999

To reproduce:
1.  Access JIRA Admin
2.  Select a project
3.  Select Configure Project Link
4.  Attempt to link to a project on any other type of instance
5.  One of the radio options is "No, don''t create a link from FishEye Repository <example> to Project Confluence as well" instead of "No, don't create a link from FishEye Repository officeconnector-git to Project Confluence as well"  (double apostrophe instead of single apostrophe)

Note: This can be reproduced using any kind of project link, not just Fisheye.
fields.summary: Typo in radio button option when performing project link "No, don''t create a link from FishEye Repository <example> to Project Confluence as well"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29403].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a privilege escalation vulnerabilities that affect JIRA instances, including publicly available instances (that is, Internet-facing servers). This vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass authentication and authorisation controls by hitting specially crafted URLs. The attacker does not need to have an account on the affected JIRA server. The attacker will be able to execute a large number of administrative actions.

This vulnerability has been fixed in JIRA 5.0.7 and later. Patches are available for JIRA 4.3.4, 4.4.5 and 5.0.6.

Full details are available in the advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2012-08-28

*Note:* the patch instructions files refer to JRA-29138, please ignore this, they are indeed the correct instructions.
*Note 2:* If you encounter error messages after applying the patch, see if [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/getLinksForSection+error+at+the+top+of+the+page] applies
fields.summary: Privilege escalation vulnerability
Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29401].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a cross-site request forgery (XSRF) vulnerability that affects JIRA instances, including publicly available instances (that is, Internet-facing servers).

The XSRF vulnerability relates to commenting on issues. An attacker might take advantage of the vulnerability to make other users to post issue comments of his choice.

You can read more about XSRF attacks at http://www.cgisecurity.com/csrf-faq.html and other places on the web.

This vulnerability affects JIRA 4.2 and above, and has been fixed in JIRA 5.1

More information is available in the advisory at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2012-08-28
fields.summary: Cross-Site Request Forgery vulnerability

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29400].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed 2 open redirect vulnerabilities that affect JIRA instances, including publicly available instances (that is, Internet-facing servers).

Parameter-based redirection vulnerabilities allow an attacker to craft a JIRA URL in such a way that a user clicking on this URL will be redirected to a different web site. This can be used for phishing.

These vulnerabilities affect JIRA 4.3.3 and above, and have been fixed in JIRA 5.1.1.

More information is available in the advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2012-08-28
fields.summary: Open Redirect vulnerabilities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29397].
  {panel}

Copied to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2137

The Activity Stream gadget does not render the images as it does not include the base url of Confluence. Since it does not have the base url prepended, the links are broken and images aren't rendered (it tries to resolve the image with the JIRA base url).
The following was the test (replicated locally with 5.1.1 JIRA and Confluence 4.2.11).
* Confluence and JIRA in two different machines
* Confluence using JIRA for user management (appears with different user management also)
* Activity stream gadget added to JIRA dashboard
* The images that are added to Confluence without resizing works correctly.
* The images which are resized in Confluence fails to show up in the Activity stream gadget (it does not have a base url prepended and it breaks).
* The same error happens for gallery too.
fields.summary: Confluence Images Not Displayed in JIRA activity Stream
As a User, I Would Like To Group by time-period in Two-Dimensional Statistics Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29381].
  {panel}

The Two Dimensional Gadget has a field named "Number of Results" with a default value of 5 and description text "Number of results to display." The problem is that people don't know what this means - X? Y? Does it affect the load on JIRA?

A better description text would be:

"Number of rows to display, use 0 to display all rows."

I updated https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Two-Dimensional+Filter+Statistics+Gadget with this information already.
fields.summary: A better description for the Number of Results parameter
Option to store attachments in the database

Sharing Issue template customization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29373].
  {panel}

h4. Problem Description
*It's only applicable to OnDemand instance*
If you add user from Administration, and put blank on password field, it mentioned _If you do not enter a password, one will be generated automatically._ and if you check Send notification Email, it displayed _Send an email to the user you have just created, which will allow them to set up their password (if applicable)._. The user will receive email notification, and there's a _Set my password_ button, and it's directed to User profile which requires user password that they don't have.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Navigate to _Administration >> User Management >> Users_
# Click *Create User* button
# Leave the password blank and put the username and email
# Check Send Notification Email
# Upon receiving the notification, the button redirected to User profile that redirected to User profile.

h4. Workaround
You could click _Request New Password_ instead to reset your password
fields.summary: Adding user without specifying password redirect to user profile that required password

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29371].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

It would be useful to be able to configure which fields is shown and which is not shown according to which workflow step it is transitioning into.

An example of how this would work :

* Have a screen with 10 fields
* Configure it so that 5 fields will appear when transitioning to step 2, and the other 5 will be shown in step 3
fields.summary: Allow dynamic changes of the field configuration in a single screen according to workflow steps
Support browser zooming
Add more functionality to Scheme Tools

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29361].
  {panel}

When viewing a version in the roadmap view sub tasks are not nested under their parent tasks in a local manner. This completely eliminates any possibility of easy observing relationship between issues at a glance.

Proper lay out would increase usability greatly. 

Example of a more usable layout:


Sorted by Key but nesting sub tasks then sorting them by key under their parents:

VERSION 1
[Task 1]
   [Sub-task 1]
   [Sub-Task 2]
[Task 2]
   [Sub-Task 3]
[Task 3]
[Task 4]
fields.summary: Roadmap: Sub-Tasks are not nested under their parent tasks in the road map when viewing a version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29359].
  {panel}

I'd like the ability to set the Time Tracking to display in hh: mm: ss

The current available options are: (e.g. 4 days, 4 hours, 30 minutes), days (e.g. 4d 4.5h) or hours (e.g. 36.5h).
Which ends up showing as the following:

!screenshot-1.jpg|thumbnail!

Due to the configurations it can also happen the following:

!TimeTrackingJira2.png|thumbnail!

This makes the time tracking hard to understand once it follows the rule below:

||Minute ||Hour ||
|51 |0.85 |
|53|0.88333...|

E.g.: Logging 51m Jira will break to 0.85h due to the Time Tracking settings, to log 53m Jira would have to break the value to 0.88333...
fields.summary: Time Tracking Configuration

*Reproduction Steps*

# Add a comment to a JIRA issue
# Set the comment security level to be restricted to the "Administrators" role
# In the comment content, mention users who only have "Users" role
# Submit the comment
# *Bug* The comment content will be sent via an email mentions notification to the mentioned users.

JIRA should not send mention notifications to users who do not match the security level set for the comment.

hello.

we have update from 4.4 to 5.1.2, all went well, now one of our users was pointing on the follow:

when we create a new issue with the + Create Issue (left of the search bar) when we are on the dashboard. The activity streamer is not reloaded and the new created issue is not showing automaticly. 

We think that with this great product, what is pointing in the new release to: Inline editing and fewer page loads. it must done automaticly.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29348].
  {panel}

To reproduce :

# Open an issue on 2 different browsers.
# Click in the description area to edit the issue description using inline edit on one browser
# On the other browser, click in the description section to edit the description
# Note : the description field still has old value in it and has not been refreshed.
# Now edit the description field and save changes.
# The previous changes (done at Step 2) have been lost.


This was not the case when inline editing was not available, because when you opened an issue for edit, the screen would refresh and load the latest content.
fields.summary: Inline edit overwrites work if multiple users edit the same field from the same issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29335].
  {panel}

Emails from a server will use JIRA or Local timezones (semi unpredictably), never user configured timezones. 

Steps to reproduce:

# Configure your user to use non JIRA default timezones. In my test I used America - GMT -8 Los Angelas.
# Configure JIRA to auto detect system time.
# Enable notify me on my changes in the user profile
# Enable email notifications on a project
# Configure an outbound email server
# Create an issue, and verify that the time in the email is correct.
# Shut down the instance.
# Change the timezone on instance host. In my case, I used GMT-6 Chicago.
# Bring the instance back online.
# Create an issue and see the time. Time will be matched to LOCAL AND JIRA.  *IGNORES USER SETTING*
# Change JIRA to use GMT-8 Los Angelas.
# Create an issue and see the email. Time will be matched to JIRA. *IGNORES LOCAL TIME AND USER TIME, ONLY VIEWS JIRA TIME*
# Change JIRA time to GMT -6 Chicago.
# Shut down JIRA.
# Change local time to GMT -8.
# Start JIRA.
# Create an issue. Time will be matched to LOCAL. *IGNORES JIRA TIME AND USER TIME, ONLY VIEWS LOCAL TIME*
fields.summary: Time in email ignores user set timezone and other shenanigans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29334].
  {panel}

We are missing the option to share filters to all existing groups even if you are not member of this group. This option is especially important as it controls which rapid boards are visible to users too. 
For sure this need to be controlled by a special right and not everybody should have this option by default. Also I would vote for restricting the share with everybody option with the same right.

Use Cases:
* PO would like to share a filter with a team
* employee would like to share a filter to a management group

I would like to split it up on 3 different right levels:
1) no share permission at all (exists right now)
2) share to groups/projects where user is a member 
3) share to all existing groups + share with everybody
fields.summary: option to share filters to all existing groups
Update on Workflow Condition documentation
Make date <= comparison compare right up to the end of the day
JIRA fields are being included via quick-create web-resource dependency on edit comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29328].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 11 November 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,

Thanks for your votes and feedback on this bug report. 

We are happy to announce that this work has already been completed and that the issue has been resolved for JIRA 6.3.10 and later versions. 

Customers using the workaround to disable inline edit are encouraged to enable this feature again for an improved user experience after upgrading.

Thanks a lot for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to bug reports and suggestions.

Regards,

Oswaldo Hernández.
JIRA Bugmaster.
[Atlassian].
{panel} 

h4. Summary
When the user edits the Assignee using the Edit screen or the new Inline Editing feature, it triggers an Issue Updated event.

It would be better to trigger the Issue Assigned event whenever the Assignee is changed, no matter how it was changed.

h4. Workarounds
- Disable In-line editing for Assignee field - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Disable+Inline+Edit+for+Assignee+Field
- Use the 'Issue Updated' event for notifications, as that event is triggered instead.
fields.summary: Editing Assignee should trigger 'Issue Assigned' event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29327].
  {panel}

There are plenty of Version events:

* VersionArchiveEvent
* VersionCreateEvent
* VersionDeleteEvent
* VersionMergeEvent
* VersionMoveEvent
* VersionReleaseEvent
* VersionUnarchiveEvent
* VersionUnreleaseEvent

However, one seems to be missing: {{VersionUpdateEvent}}.

My use-case for this is that I'm writing a plugin that has to keep an external system informed about when a bug is scheduled for release. 

While I have written an event listener for when a version is added/removed for the _Fix for_ field, this does not cover the situation when an existing version is rescheduled. Therefore, I need to be able to listen for {{VersionUpdateEvent}}.
fields.summary: Add support for VersionUpdateEvent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29325].
  {panel}

In every non-US environment one of the first things an admin does is adjust the software to the current locale. This usually involves choosing language, decimal separator and date/time formats, if not recognized automatically.

Currently, NLS settings exist in two places (afaik):
- System -> User interface -> Section "Design", below the colors
- System -> General configuration -> Extended ... (Button on bottom)

My suggestions are:

1. Have all NLS settings at *one* place and have a separate section or menu entry "NLS settings" or such. Do not hide them away.

2. Make it explicit what each NLS setting affects. There is some nice description for the four Java/JavaScript date/time settings available, but there is no comment on what the date/time settings in the Design section are supposed to affect or not affect. There's also no hint how the date/time settings in the Design settings complement or interfer with the field date/time settings.

3. Things would imho be much more comfortable if JIRA came with a few widely used presets for NLS settings, such as
  - US format, numbers only: 12/31/1999 5:32 PM
  - US format, abbrev. months: Dec/31/1999 5:32 PM
  - European format: 31.12.1999 17:32
  - ISO standard format: 1999-12-31 17:32
  - maybe one or two others...
  (There are web pages listing the world's most common date/time formats.)
This would avoid the need to study the format descriptions first and play with the Java/JavaScript date/time setting, thus reducing the chance of errors.

4. It is currently not clear for me as an admin whether NLS settings are JIRA-wide for *any* user or whether they depend on the locale setting of each user's PC, which might vary. Ideally translations, date/time formats and such would automatically adjust to the defaults of each user's locale, with no need for the admin to specify *any* explicit format.
See also issue JRA-10613 (Time and date formats should be depending on users profile) for this.

I hope these suggestions will help improve JIRA. Feel free to split them into separate issues if you like.
fields.summary: Improve NLS and date/time format configuration in JIRA
Possibility to track the clone issue via interface
Select All Check box needed in Issue Selector Screen
Allow JIRA OnDemand to set the value of a field based on the contents of another field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29314].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

It would be great if JIRA had a feature to dump the mail queue content on the file system before shutdown, if the mail queue gets stuck or on a crash (like on a heap dump). As well you would need to implement a way to resume the mail queue from the same dump file(s).

Best regards,
Lucas Timm
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: JIRA dumping the mail queue content before a shutdown
Custom Issue Collector CSS
Typo in Issue Collector "More Instructions"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29307].
  {panel}

When adding custom fields they can only be restricted to certain projects but there is no way to make them available for a scheme. Manually choosing the projects a custom field applies to is not a good way because it is very error-prone (think about what happens when the customer adds projects at a later stage). Therefore most people end up using the global context but restricting the field to certain field configurations. However, the field is automatically added to all field configurations and per default SHOWN. This means you have to go through every single field configuration and HIDE it.

I can think of two possible solutions:

(1) Implement Custom Field Schemes

OR

(2) Implement another wizard page when adding a new custom field that allows to show / hide the custom field for certain field configurations (just like it is done with Screens)
fields.summary: Custom Field Schemes / Context
New Custom Field creation should field configuration context page

fields.description:
Dear Support Team,

It is not possible to create a JIRA Ticket in Chrome 21 as I receive the following Error Message after using a radio button to select a region for our customer networks:

"Error creating JSON Object: TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' or undefnied."

It works fine in other browsers though.

Is there anything you can do against it?


Thanks,
Chris
fields.summary: JSON Object TypeError in Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29295].
  {panel}

I noticed that JIRA.Mention is now using Backbone.js and the old implementation is available as JIRA.LegacyMention

That is great but I had extended the old implementation to provide alternative REST endpoint (/user/search instead of /user/viewissue/search). This breaks in JIRA 5.1.2

It would be ideal that the JIRA.Mention would just accept options to either use custom endpoint and/or simply use /user/search when projectKey is not provided. That way I could use JIRA.Mention without hacking to get it to work with non-project specific mentioning.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Make JIRA.Mention controller accept optional REST URL to enable re-use
Allow members of group/role to share dashboard ownership
Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget on Custom Version Field Includes only Non-Archived Versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29289].
  {panel}

We've seen this in JIRA Studio's functional test runs a few times, and aren't sure yet if it's a Studio-specific problem or a general JIRA/Pico issue:

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5128

Any help or insight we could get from the JIRA dev team would be appreciated!

I've attached a couple of thread dumps.
fields.summary: Remove deadlocks in PicoContainer after imports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29282].
  {panel}

This is about:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Activity+Stream+Gadget
In the Adding the 'Activity Stream' gadget to your Dashboard section

I ran some tests with JIRA5+ and Conf 3.5.x and 4.x versions.

I found that if connecting JIRA 5+ to Conf 3.5.x, you don't get the option to disable the stream from Conf in activity streams. This only appears when connecting JIRA 5+ to Conf 4+.

I logged this for a customer who ran into this issue and thought it'd be a good idea to have the documents note that.

Thanks!
fields.summary: activity stream available stream options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29281].
  {panel}

On The Activity Stream, if the source code path to the code in FishEye contains a space, Jira automatically fills this space with an "+" instead of a "%20" and as a result, these links are broken and produce a file not found error.

!ActivityStreamChangedSet.png!

However, clicking the same changeset on the SourceTab, the spaces will be defined as %20, and this will lead to the correct link.

!SourceTabChangedSet.png!
fields.summary: FishEye changeset link from the Activity Stream will uses + rather %20 for spaces

fields.description:
Hey Jira Support-Team,

we have the following issue:
Jira has its generated user groups: users, developers and administrators. We've created some additional user groups: EPIC-PhD, Forecasting, IMR-Lab.
When I add a new User, he will be automatically added to jira-users, but also to our additional groups EPIC-PhD, Forecasting and IMR-Lab.

How to deactivate this automatic group membership?
A new user should just be added to jira-users.
(We use the internal user server of Jira)

Best regards,
Frank Blechschmidt
Hasso-Plattner Institute Potsdam, Germany
fields.summary: Undesired automatic group membership

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29258].
  {panel}

Please include on the Road Map documentation a note about  how it is ordered. 

The Road Map displays the reverse order of the versions set on (Administration > Projects > Select a project > Versions).

Thanks!
Clarissa.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29247].
  {panel}

The current workflow designer is very clumsy and takes huge amount to time to format existing workflow design. Given the problems mentioned by other users, it would be good to allow uploading of images directly.

Advantages:
* There are good and easy designers in the market which generates images, those images are very to upload (Like Avatars).
* Sometimes we edit the workflow and skip some statuses. However, we cannot remove those statuses from WF because WF is active. It never use to be visible before but now you see the obsolete status like an island in the WF diagram.
fields.summary: Workflow designer should allow to upload images.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29245].
  {panel}

If you attach a screenshot in jira 5.1.1 you can't see any progress of the upload. You simple need to belive that something is happening in the backgound, if the upload is complete everything is fine and the images appeare under the appropriate section. Some of our users are very irritated that their upload or screenshot attachment didn't work because of the lack of any visual feedback while the file is beeing process in the background. You may implement some kind of loading gif that appears until the image appears. That would get the casual user happy.

Thank you in advance for looking into that.

Regards,
Björn
fields.summary: Provide visual feedback for attachment upload

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29243].
  {panel}

The issue JRA-28788 was raised as Labels could not be inline-edited on the view-issue page if the Labels field was not in the Edit Screen. In previous versions of JIRA it was possible to edit the labels field even if the field was not present in the Edit Screen. 

It has been decided not to restore this behaviour in JIRA 5.1 and beyond so an alternative to inline editing Labels needs to be documented.

There are two options:
# Press the 'l' key to bring up the Labels dialog
# Add the Labels field to the Edit Screen

Further, to increase visibility of the issue, it was proposed that the JIRA Admin Helper Plugin be used to help diagnose why people cannot edit a particular field. Currently the plugin does not load the Edit Screen details on the View Issue page. I will raise an issue with the developer to see if this is possible.
fields.summary: Knowledge base entry for Inline Editing Labels field
